name: Everest Base Camp Trek
description: Experience the journey to the base of the world's highest mountain. This 14-day trek takes you through stunning Himalayan landscapes, Sherpa villages, and offers breathtaking views of Mount Everest and surrounding peaks. Includes experienced guides, accommodation in tea houses, and all necessary permits.
highlights: Panoramic views of Mount Everest (8,848m)
Experience authentic Sherpa culture and hospitality
Visit the historic Tengboche Monastery
Professional guides and porters included

name: Annapurna Circuit Trek
description: The Annapurna Circuit is one of the most diverse trekking routes in the world, taking you through varied landscapes from subtropical forests to high alpine environments. Cross the challenging Thorong La Pass (5,416m) and witness the stunning mountain panoramas of the Annapurna Range.
highlights: Cross the challenging Thorong La Pass at 5,416m
Experience diverse ecosystems and cultures
Visit the holy temple at Muktinath
Enjoy natural hot springs at Tatopani

name: Kathmandu Cultural Heritage Tour
description: Explore the rich cultural heritage of Kathmandu Valley with this comprehensive tour of UNESCO World Heritage Sites. Visit ancient temples, royal palaces, and traditional Newari villages. Learn about Nepal's unique blend of Hindu and Buddhist traditions from knowledgeable local guides.
highlights: Visit Pashupatinath Temple, Boudhanath Stupa and Swayambhunath
Explore Kathmandu Durbar Square and ancient royal palaces
Experience traditional Newari architecture
Expert cultural guide to explain historical significance

name: Chitwan Safari Experience
description: Explore Chitwan National Park, Nepal's first national park and a UNESCO World Heritage site. Go on wildlife safaris to spot the endangered one-horned rhinoceros, Royal Bengal tigers, and over 700 species of wildlife. Includes jeep safari, canoe ride, and cultural program with the indigenous Tharu community.
highlights: Jeep safari to spot one-horned rhinoceros and Royal Bengal tigers
Canoe ride along the Rapti River
Tharu cultural dance performance
Bird watching with over 500 species

name: Pokhara Leisure Package
description: Enjoy the serene beauty of Pokhara, Nepal's lake city nestled beneath the Annapurna mountain range. This package includes boating on Phewa Lake, sunrise views from Sarangkot, visits to Davis Falls and Gupteshwor Cave, and optional paragliding or zip-lining adventures.
highlights: Boating on the serene Phewa Lake
Sunrise view from Sarangkot Hill
Visit to Davis Falls and peace pagoda
Comfortable lakeside accommodation

name: Traditional Newari Cuisine Tour
description: Embark on a culinary journey through the ancient flavors of Newari cuisine, one of Nepal's oldest and most sophisticated food cultures. Visit traditional Newari restaurants in Patan and Bhaktapur, learn about the cultural significance of different dishes, and enjoy a hands-on cooking class to prepare authentic Newari specialties.
highlights: Sample over 12 authentic Newari dishes
Learn traditional cooking techniques
Visit local markets for ingredients
Cultural insights from a local food expert

name: Lumbini Buddhist Circuit
description: Visit the birthplace of Lord Buddha and explore the sacred Buddhist circuit in Lumbini. Tour includes the sacred garden where Buddha was born, Maya Devi Temple, Ashoka Pillar, and various international monasteries built by different Buddhist countries. Learn about Buddha's life journey and Buddhist philosophy from expert guides.
highlights: Visit Maya Devi Temple, the exact birthplace of Buddha
See the ancient Ashoka Pillar with inscriptions
Explore international monasteries representing different Buddhist traditions
Meditation session in the Sacred Garden

name: Paragliding in Pokhara
description: Experience the thrill of tandem paragliding over the breathtaking landscape of Pokhara. Soar like a bird with experienced pilots and enjoy panoramic views of Phewa Lake, the Annapurna mountain range, and the picturesque Pokhara Valley. No prior experience needed, suitable for all adventure enthusiasts.
highlights: Tandem flight with certified paragliding pilots
Stunning views of Annapurna and Machapuchare mountains
Aerial perspective of Phewa Lake and Pokhara city
HD photos and videos of your flight available

name: Pashupatinath Evening Aarti
description: Witness the mesmerizing evening aarti (worship ceremony) at Pashupatinath Temple, one of the most sacred Hindu temples dedicated to Lord Shiva. Experience the spiritual ambiance as priests perform the ritualistic offering of light with oil lamps accompanied by devotional music along the banks of the holy Bagmati River.
highlights: Witness traditional Bagmati Aarti ceremony
Learn about Hindu rituals and their significance
Visit the main temple complex (exterior for non-Hindus)
Spiritual experience with knowledgeable guide

name: Bhaktapur Medieval City Walk
description: Explore the exceptionally preserved medieval city of Bhaktapur, known as the 'City of Devotees'. This guided walking tour takes you through ancient squares, temples, and palaces while explaining the historical significance and artistic heritage of this UNESCO World Heritage site. Includes pottery making demonstration and traditional Juju Dhau (King Curd) tasting.
highlights: Explore Bhaktapur Durbar Square with its ancient palaces
Visit the famous 55-Window Palace and Nyatapola Temple
Pottery making demonstration in traditional Potter's Square
Taste authentic Juju Dhau (King Curd) - Bhaktapur's specialty

name: Momo Cooking Class
description: Learn to make Nepal's most beloved dish - momos (dumplings) - in this hands-on cooking class. Discover different varieties including vegetable, chicken, and buff momos with various cooking techniques like steaming, kothey (pan-fried), and jhol (soup). Create authentic Nepali dipping sauces and enjoy your creations with a local family.
highlights: Learn authentic momo making techniques from local chefs
Create three different styles of momos
Make traditional Nepali achar (dipping sauce)
Recipe cards to take home

name: Nagarkot Sunrise Tour
description: Witness a spectacular Himalayan sunrise from Nagarkot, famous for its panoramic mountain views. Watch the first rays of sunlight illuminate the Himalayan peaks including Mount Everest on clear days. After sunrise, enjoy breakfast with mountain views followed by a refreshing hike through pine forests and traditional villages.
highlights: Panoramic sunrise views of the Himalayas including Everest
Breakfast with mountain vistas
Village walk through traditional settlements
Comfortable transportation from Kathmandu

name: Patan Heritage Artisan Tour
description: Discover the living traditions of Patan, Nepal's city of fine arts. Visit traditional workshops of master craftsmen continuing centuries-old techniques of metal casting, wood carving, thangka painting, and stone sculpting. Learn about the intricate processes behind Nepal's famous artistic heritage and meet the artists keeping these traditions alive.
highlights: Visit traditional metal casting workshops
Watch master thangka painters at work
See stone and wood carving demonstrations
Support local artisans with fair trade practices

name: Langtang Valley Trek
description: Trek through the beautiful Langtang Valley, often called 'the valley of glaciers'. This less crowded trekking route offers stunning mountain views, diverse landscapes, and insights into the unique Tamang culture. Visit ancient monasteries, traditional villages, and enjoy the pristine natural beauty of Langtang National Park.
highlights: Trek through diverse landscapes from forests to alpine meadows
Experience Tamang culture and traditional villages
Visit ancient Buddhist monasteries
Views of Langtang Lirung (7,227m) and surrounding peaks

name: Bandipur Village Stay
description: Experience authentic rural Nepali life in the preserved Newari town of Bandipur, perched on a ridge with spectacular mountain views. Stay in a restored traditional house, explore the car-free bazaar with its 18th-century architecture, enjoy home-cooked meals with a local family, and hike to nearby caves and viewpoints.
highlights: Stay in a beautifully restored traditional Newari house
Explore the well-preserved 18th-century architecture
Hike to Siddha Cave, one of the largest caves in Nepal
Mountain views from Thani Mai Temple viewpoint

name: Bardia Wildlife Safari
description: Explore Bardia National Park, Nepal's largest and most undisturbed wilderness area in the western Terai. This remote safari experience offers excellent opportunities to spot wild elephants, one-horned rhinoceros, Royal Bengal tigers, and over 30 different mammals in their natural habitat with fewer tourists than Chitwan.
highlights: Jeep and walking safaris with experienced naturalists
High chances of tiger sightings
Tharu cultural experience
Stay in eco-friendly jungle lodges

name: Upper Mustang Trek
description: Journey to the 'Forbidden Kingdom' of Upper Mustang, a remote trans-Himalayan region with a distinct Tibetan culture. Explore medieval villages, ancient cave monasteries, and stunning desert landscapes surrounded by snow-capped peaks. This restricted area offers insights into one of the most preserved Tibetan cultures in the world.
highlights: Visit Lo Manthang, the walled capital of the ancient kingdom
Explore 15th-century monasteries and royal palaces
See thousands of year-old sky caves
Experience Tibetan culture and traditions

name: Ghandruk Traditional Village Experience
description: Immerse yourself in the traditional lifestyle of the Gurung people in the picturesque village of Ghandruk. Stay with a local family, learn about Gurung customs and traditions, help with daily activities, and enjoy spectacular views of the Annapurna mountain range. Perfect for travelers seeking an authentic cultural experience.
highlights: Homestay with a traditional Gurung family
Learn about Gurung culture and customs
Cook traditional meals with your host family
Panoramic views of Annapurna South and Machapuchare

name: Nepali Cooking Class in Kathmandu
description: Learn to cook authentic Nepali dishes in this hands-on cooking class. Visit a local market to select fresh ingredients, then prepare a complete Nepali meal including dal bhat (lentils and rice), tarkari (vegetables), achar (pickles), and desserts. Understand the use of traditional spices and cooking techniques under the guidance of an experienced local chef.
highlights: Market tour to select fresh ingredients
Cook 4-5 authentic Nepali dishes
Learn about traditional spices and their medicinal properties
Recipe booklet to take home

name: Phewa Lake Sunset Boating
description: Enjoy a serene boating experience on Phewa Lake in Pokhara as the sun sets behind the Annapurna mountains. Paddle around the lake, visit Tal Barahi Temple on the lake island, and witness the magical reflection of the Himalayas on the calm waters. Option to have a professional boatman or row yourself.
highlights: Peaceful sunset views over the Annapurna mountains
Visit Tal Barahi Temple on the lake island
See the reflection of Machapuchare (Fishtail Mountain) on the lake
Option for traditional wooden boat or paddle boat
